images.copyright: Flag display at the US Capitol, Washington, DC (© kmiragaya/Adobe Stock)
images.title: Waving with pride
images.caption: Flag Day
images.desc: Every June 14, we celebrate national pride and the fabric that unites us—the American flag. It was only when Congress passed the Flag Resolution on June 14, 1777, that the Stars and Stripes design was adopted as the official flag of the United States. To commemorate this historic milestone, then-president Woodrow Wilson proclaimed June 14 as Flag Day in 1916—a tribute to the banner that came to represent America's identity, values, and unity.
